name: Plenus Lending Solutions
overview: Plenus is the only Israeli Venture Lending Fund, providing fully secured equity-based credit facilities/loans to revenue stage technology companies. Plenus Venture Lending was founded in September 2000 to answer market demand for alternative funding sources. Leveraging its strong relationships with the global venture capital community, Plenus designs credit facilities focusing on enhancing growth and limiting equity dilution. In July 2002 Plenus merged with Golden Gate, an Israeli based Bridge fund. In 2005 Plenus raised its second Venture Lending fund, and in 2007 it closed its third fund, Plenus III. Plenus Venture Lending has a total of over $220mm under management. It has completed over 60 deals to date of over $260mm total credit facilities. Investors in Plenus Venture Lending include blue chip Israeli institutions such as insurance companies, pension funds, and banks. In 2006 Plenus Mezzanine was founded and has had its first closing. Plenus is affiliated with Viola Group, which manages over $1.8 billion. The Plenus team’s dynamic combination of financial and operational experience is the key that has enabled the fund to grow such a successful and diversified portfolio and become a real partner to its portfolio companies.
